thing-type.label: Group Multiple Cameras
thing-type.description: Show multiple cameras as a single rotating feed

parameter-group.name: Settings
parameter-group.label: Main Settings
parameter-group.description: Settings required to setup a group of cameras.

parameter-group.name: FFmpeg Setup
parameter-group.label: FFmpeg Settings
parameter-group.description: Settings that setup or effect the video stream.

parameter.name: pollTime
parameter.label: Time Before Rotating to Next Camera
parameter.description: Time in milliseconds of how long to display a camera before changing to the next camera in the group.

parameter.name: motionChangesOrder
parameter.label: Motion Changes Order
parameter.description: When switched ON, any motion on a camera will make it show ahead of other cameras in the rotation.

parameter.name: firstCamera
parameter.label: First Camera ID
parameter.description: Enter the 'Unique ID' of the camera you wish to show first.

parameter.name: secondCamera
parameter.label: Second Camera ID
parameter.description: Enter the 'Unique ID' of the camera you wish to show second.

parameter.name: thirdCamera
parameter.label: Third Camera ID
parameter.description: Enter the 'Unique ID' of the camera you wish to show third. Leave blank if the group is less than 3.

parameter.name: forthCamera
parameter.label: Forth Camera ID
parameter.description: Enter the 'Unique ID' of the camera you wish to show forth. Leave blank if the group is less than 4.

parameter.name: ffmpegLocation
parameter.label: FFmpeg Location
parameter.description: The full path including the filename for where you have installed FFmpeg. Default should work for Linux, but For windows use this format, c:\ffmpeg\bin\ffmpeg.exe

parameter.name: ffmpegOutput
parameter.label: FFmpeg Output Folder
parameter.description: Leave this blank and the binding will use the openHAB userdata folder. Alternatively, a unique path for each camera that ends with a slash and has write permissions can be entered.

parameter.name: ipWhitelist
parameter.label: IP Whitelist
parameter.description: Enter any IP's inside (brackets) that you wish to allow to access the video stream. 'DISABLE' will allow all devices on your network unrestricted access.

thing-type.label: RTSP/HTTP IP Camera
thing-type.description: Use when your camera is not ONVIF compatible.

parameter-group.name: Settings
parameter-group.label: Main Settings
parameter-group.description: Settings required to connect to the camera.

parameter-group.name: FFmpeg Setup
parameter-group.label: FFmpeg Settings
parameter-group.description: Settings that setup or effect the video stream.

parameter-group.name: Image ch Settings
parameter-group.label: Image channel settings
parameter-group.description: Settings for the image channel features which is not recommended to be used. See readme for more info.

parameter.name: updateImageWhen
parameter.label: Update Image Channel When:
parameter.description: The Image channel can be set to update in a number of ways. Recommend you set this to never updates as per the readme.

options.option: Start of Motion and Audio Alarms (23)

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.label: IP Address
parameter.description: Use this format 192.168.1.2 and do not include the port number.

parameter.name: port
parameter.label: Port for HTTP
parameter.description: This port will be used for HTTP calls ie for fetching the snapshot.

parameter.name: snapshotUrl
parameter.label: Snapshot URL
parameter.description: Enter a HTTP URL to where a snapshot can be seen if entered into any browser.

parameter.name: mjpegUrl
parameter.label: MJPEG URL
parameter.description: Full HTTP address to where a MJPEG stream can be watched if entered into any browser.

parameter.name: ffmpegInput
parameter.label: FFmpeg Input
parameter.description: Enter any HTTP or RTSP URL that FFmpeg can use as an input. Best if H.264 format is used.

parameter.name: ffmpegInputOptions
parameter.label: FFmpeg Input Options
parameter.description: This gives you direct access to specify FFmpeg options before the -i.

parameter.name: ffmpegLocation
parameter.label: FFmpeg Install Location
parameter.description: The full path including the filename for where you have installed FFmpeg. Default should work for Linux, but For windows use this format, c:\ffmpeg\bin\ffmpeg.exe

parameter.name: ffmpegOutput
parameter.label: FFmpeg Output Folder
parameter.description: Leave this blank and the binding will use the openHAB userdata folder. Alternatively, a unique path for each camera that ends with a slash and has write permissions can be entered.

parameter.name: hlsOutOptions
parameter.label: HLS Out Options
parameter.description: This gives you direct access to specify your own FFmpeg options to be used.

parameter.name: mjpegOptions
parameter.label: MJPEG Options
parameter.description: This gives you direct access to specify your own FFmpeg options to be used for MJPEG streams.

parameter.name: snapshotOptions
parameter.label: Snapshot Options
parameter.description: Specify your own FFmpeg options to be used when creating snapshots from RTSP.

parameter.name: alarmInputUrl
parameter.label: Alarm Input URL
parameter.description: Leave blank to use the ffmpegInput as the source for detecting motion with FFmpeg, or enter any HTTP or RTSP URL. TIP: Using a low res source can save CPU usage.

parameter.name: motionOptions
parameter.label: Motion Options
parameter.description: This gives you direct access to specify your own FFmpeg options to be used for detecting motion.

parameter.name: gifOutOptions
parameter.label: GIF Out Options
parameter.description: This gives you direct access to specify your own FFmpeg options to be used for animated GIF files.

parameter.name: mp4OutOptions
parameter.label: MP4 Out Options
parameter.description: This gives you direct access to specify your own FFmpeg options to be used for recording MP4 files.

parameter.name: gifPreroll
parameter.label: GIF Preroll
parameter.description: Store this many snapshots from BEFORE you trigger a GIF creation.

parameter.name: ipWhitelist
parameter.label: IP Whitelist
parameter.description: Enter any IP's inside (brackets) that you wish to allow to access the video stream. 'DISABLE' will allow all devices on your network unrestricted access.

parameter.name: username
parameter.label: Username
parameter.description: Enter the User name used to connect to your camera. Leave blank if your camera does not use login details.

parameter.name: password
parameter.label: Password
parameter.description: Enter the password for your camera. Leave blank if your camera does not use one.

parameter.name: pollTime
parameter.label: Poll Time
parameter.description: Most features are made on demand and not polled, but some features require a regular snapshot to work. Default is "1000" which is 1 second.

thing-type.label: ONVIF IP Camera
thing-type.description: Use when the binding does not list your brand of ONVIF camera.

parameter-group.name: Settings
parameter-group.label: Main Settings
parameter-group.description: Settings required to connect to the camera.

parameter-group.name: FFmpeg Setup
parameter-group.label: FFmpeg Settings
parameter-group.description: Settings that setup or effect the video stream.

parameter-group.name: Image ch Settings
parameter-group.label: Image channel settings
parameter-group.description: Settings for the image channel features which is not recommended to be used. See readme for more info.

parameter.name: updateImageWhen
parameter.label: Update Image Channel When:
parameter.description: The Image channel can be set to update in a number of ways. Recommend you set this to never updates as per the readme.

options.option: Start of Motion and Audio Alarms (23)

parameter.name: mjpegUrl
parameter.label: MJPEG URL
parameter.description: Full HTTP address to where a MJPEG stream can be watched if entered into any browser.

parameter.name: ffmpegInput
parameter.label: FFmpeg Input
parameter.description: Leave this blank to use the auto detected RTSP address, or enter a URL for any type of stream that FFmpeg can use as an input.

parameter.name: ffmpegInputOptions
parameter.label: FFmpeg Input Options
parameter.description: This gives you direct access to specify FFmpeg options before the -i.

parameter.name: ffmpegLocation
parameter.label: FFmpeg Install Location
parameter.description: The full path including the filename for where you have installed FFmpeg. For windows use this format, c:\ffmpeg\bin\ffmpeg.exe

parameter.name: ffmpegOutput
parameter.label: FFmpeg Output Folder
parameter.description: Leave this blank and the binding will use the openHAB userdata folder. Alternatively, a unique path for each camera that ends with a slash and has write permissions can be entered.

parameter.name: hlsOutOptions
parameter.label: HLS Out Options
parameter.description: This gives you direct access to specify your own FFmpeg options to be used.

parameter.name: gifOutOptions
parameter.label: GIF Out Options
parameter.description: This gives you direct access to specify your own FFmpeg options to be used for animated GIF files.

parameter.name: mp4OutOptions
parameter.label: MP4 Out Options
parameter.description: This gives you direct access to specify your own FFmpeg options to be used for recording MP4 files.

parameter.name: mjpegOptions
parameter.label: MJPEG Options
parameter.description: This gives you direct access to specify your own FFmpeg options to be used for MJPEG streams.

parameter.name: snapshotOptions
parameter.label: Snapshot Options
parameter.description: Specify your own FFmpeg options to be used when creating snapshots from RTSP.

parameter.name: alarmInputUrl
parameter.label: Alarm Input URL
parameter.description: Leave blank to use the ffmpegInput as the source for detecting motion with FFmpeg, or enter any HTTP or RTSP URL. TIP: Using a low res source can save CPU usage.

parameter.name: motionOptions
parameter.label: Motion Options
parameter.description: This gives you direct access to specify your own FFmpeg options to be used for detecting motion.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.label: IP Address
parameter.description: Use this format 192.168.1.2 and do not include the port number.

parameter.name: port
parameter.label: Port for HTTP
parameter.description: This port will be used for HTTP calls for fetching the snapshot and alarm states.

parameter.name: username
parameter.label: Username
parameter.description: Enter the User name used to connect to your camera. Leave blank if your camera does not use login details.

parameter.name: password
parameter.label: Password
parameter.description: Enter the password for your camera. Leave blank if your camera does not use one.

parameter.name: onvifPort
parameter.label: ONVIF Port
parameter.description: The port your camera uses for ONVIF connections. This is needed for PTZ movement, alarm events and auto discovery of RTSP and snapshot URLs.

parameter.name: onvifMediaProfile
parameter.label: ONVIF Media Profile
parameter.description: Cameras can supply more than one stream at different resolutions and formats. 0 selects the main-stream and 1 or above are the sub-streams. Sometimes you need to turn on sub-streams in the cameras setup before they can be used.

parameter.name: ipWhitelist
parameter.label: IP Whitelist
parameter.description: Enter any IP's inside (brackets) that you wish to allow to access the video stream. 'DISABLE' will allow all devices on your network unrestricted access.

parameter.name: pollTime
parameter.label: Poll Time
parameter.description: Most features are made on demand and not polled, but some features require a regular snapshot to work. Default is "1000" which is 1 second.

parameter.name: ptzContinuous
parameter.label: Use Continuous PTZ
parameter.description: Select if you want Relative (false) or Continuous (true) movements.

parameter.name: gifPreroll
parameter.label: GIF Preroll
parameter.description: Store this many snapshots from BEFORE you trigger a GIF creation.

parameter.name: snapshotUrl
parameter.label: Snapshot URL
parameter.description: Leave blank to use the autodetected URL for snapshots, or enter a HTTP URL to where a snapshot can be seen if entered into any browser.

thing-type.label: Amcrest Camera with API
thing-type.description: Use for older Amcrest Cameras, that wont work as dahua thing type.

parameter.label: FFmpeg Output Folder
parameter.description: Leave this blank and the binding will use the openHAB userdata folder. Alternatively, a unique path for each camera that ends with a slash and has write permissions can be entered.

parameter.label: HLS Out Options
parameter.description: This gives you direct access to specify your own FFmpeg options to be used.

parameter.name: gifOutOptions
parameter.label: GIF Out Options
parameter.description: This gives you direct access to specify your own FFmpeg options to be used for animated GIF files.

parameter.name: mp4OutOptions
parameter.label: MP4 Out Options
parameter.description: This gives you direct access to specify your own FFmpeg options to be used for recording MP4 files.

parameter.label: Snapshot Options
parameter.description: Specify your own FFmpeg options to be used when creating snapshots from RTSP.

parameter.name: alarmInputUrl
parameter.label: Alarm Input URL
parameter.description: Leave blank to use the FFmpegInput as the source for detecting motion with FFmpeg, or enter any HTTP or RTSP URL. TIP: Using a low res source can save CPU usage.

parameter.name: motionOptions
parameter.label: Motion Options
parameter.description: This gives you direct access to specify your own FFmpeg options to be used for detecting motion.

parameter.name: gifPreroll
parameter.label: GIF Preroll
parameter.description: Store this many snapshots from BEFORE you trigger a GIF creation.

parameter.name: ipWhitelist
parameter.label: IP Whitelist
parameter.description: Enter any IP's inside (brackets) that you wish to allow to access the video stream. 'DISABLE' will allow all devices on your network unrestricted access.

parameter.name: updateImageWhen

parameter.description: The Image channel can be set to update in a number of ways. Recommend you set this to never updates as per the readme.

options.option: Start of Motion and Audio Alarms (23)

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.label: IP Address
parameter.description: Use this format 192.168.1.2 and do not include the port number.

parameter.name: port
parameter.label: Port for HTTP
parameter.description: This port will be used for HTTP calls for fetching the snapshot and alarm states.

parameter.name: nvrChannel
parameter.label: NVR Input Channel
parameter.description: Set this to 1 if it is a stand alone camera, or to the input channel number of your NVR that the camera is connected to.

parameter.name: snapshotUrl
parameter.label: Snapshot URL
parameter.description: Leave this empty to auto detect the snapshot URL. Enter a HTTP address if you wish to over-ride with a different address which also makes the camera connect quicker.

parameter.name: onvifPort
parameter.label: ONVIF Port
parameter.description: The port your camera uses for ONVIF connections. This is needed for PTZ movement, alarm events and auto discovery of RTSP and snapshot URLs.

parameter.name: username
parameter.label: Username
parameter.description: Enter the User name used to connect to your camera. Leave blank if your camera does not use login details.

parameter.name: password
parameter.label: Password
parameter.description: Enter the password for your camera. Leave blank if your camera does not use one.

parameter.name: ptzContinuous
parameter.label: Use Continuous PTZ
parameter.description: Select if you want Relative (false) or Continuous (true) movements.

parameter.name: onvifMediaProfile
parameter.label: ONVIF Media Profile
parameter.description: Cameras can supply more than one stream at different resolutions and formats. 0 selects the main-stream and 1 or above are the sub-streams. Sometimes you need to turn on sub-streams in the cameras setup before they can be used.

parameter.name: pollTime
parameter.label: Poll Time
parameter.description: Most features are made on demand and not polled, but some features require a regular snapshot to work. Default is "1000" which is 1 second.

thing-type.label: Dahua Camera with API
thing-type.description: Use for all current Dahua cameras, as they support an API as well as ONVIF.

parameter.name: alarmInputUrl
parameter.label: Alarm Input URL
parameter.description: Leave blank to use the ffmpegInput as the source for detecting motion with FFmpeg, or enter any HTTP or RTSP URL. TIP: Using a low res source can save CPU usage.

parameter.name: motionOptions
parameter.label: Motion Options
parameter.description: This gives you direct access to specify your own FFmpeg options to be used for detecting motion.

parameter.name: gifPreroll
parameter.label: GIF Preroll
parameter.description: Store this many snapshots from BEFORE you trigger a GIF creation.

parameter.name: ipWhitelist
parameter.label: IP Whitelist
parameter.description: Enter any IP's inside (brackets) that you wish to allow to access the video stream. 'DISABLE' will allow all devices on your network unrestricted access.

parameter.name: updateImageWhen
parameter.label: Update Image Channel When:
parameter.description: The Image channel can be set to update in a number of ways. Recommend you set this to never updates as per the readme.

options.option: Start of Motion and Audio Alarms (23)

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.label: IP Address
parameter.description: Use this format 192.168.1.2 and do not include the port number.

parameter.name: port
parameter.label: Port for HTTP
parameter.description: This port will be used for HTTP calls for fetching the snapshot and alarm states.

parameter.name: snapshotUrl
parameter.label: Snapshot URL
parameter.description: Leave blank to use the autodetected URL for snapshots, or enter a HTTP URL to where a snapshot can be seen if entered into any browser.

parameter.name: customMotionAlarmUrl
parameter.label: Create your own custom enable Motion Alarm settings by entering a custom URL
parameter.description: Leave this empty to use the default, or create your own setting.

parameter.name: customAudioAlarmUrl
parameter.label: Create your own custom enable Audio Alarm settings by entering a custom URL
parameter.description: Leave this empty to use the default, or create your own setting.

parameter.name: onvifPort
parameter.label: ONVIF Port
parameter.description: The port your camera uses for ONVIF connections. This is needed for PTZ movement, alarm events and auto discovery of RTSP and snapshot URLs.

parameter.name: username
parameter.label: Username
parameter.description: Enter the User name used to connect to your camera. Leave blank if your camera does not use login details.

parameter.name: password
parameter.label: Password
parameter.description: Enter the password for your camera. Leave blank if your camera does not use one.

parameter.name: ptzContinuous
parameter.label: Use Continuous PTZ
parameter.description: Select if you want Relative (false) or Continuous (true) movements.

parameter.name: onvifMediaProfile
parameter.label: ONVIF Media Profile
parameter.description: Cameras can supply more than one stream at different resolutions and formats. 0 selects the main-stream and 1 or above are the sub-streams. Sometimes you need to turn on sub-streams in the cameras setup before they can be used.

parameter.name: pollTime
parameter.label: Poll Time
parameter.description: Most features are made on demand and not polled, but some features require a regular snapshot to work. Default is "1000" which is 1 second.

thing-type.label: Hikvision Camera with API
thing-type.description: Use for all current Hikvision Cameras as they support an API as well as ONVIF.

parameter-group.name: Settings
parameter-group.label: Main Settings
parameter-group.description: Settings required to connect to the camera.

parameter-group.name: FFmpeg Setup
parameter-group.label: FFmpeg Settings
parameter-group.description: Settings that setup or effect the video stream.

parameter-group.name: Image ch Settings
parameter-group.label: Image channel settings
parameter-group.description: Settings for the image channel features which is not recommended to be used. See readme for more info.

parameter.name: mjpegUrl
parameter.label: MJPEG URL
parameter.description: Leave this blank to use the auto detected URL, or enter a full HTTP address to where a MJPEG stream can be watched if entered into any browser.

parameter.name: ffmpegInput
parameter.label: FFmpeg Input
parameter.description: Leave this blank to use the auto detected RTSP address, or enter a URL for any type of stream that FFmpeg can use as an input.

parameter.name: ffmpegInputOptions
parameter.label: FFmpeg Input Options
parameter.description: This gives you direct access to specify FFmpeg options before the -i.

parameter.name: ffmpegLocation
parameter.label: FFmpeg Install Location
parameter.description: The full path including the filename for where you have installed FFmpeg. For windows use this format, c:\ffmpeg\bin\ffmpeg.exe

parameter.name: ffmpegOutput
parameter.label: FFmpeg Output Folder
parameter.description: Leave this blank and the binding will use the openHAB userdata folder. Alternatively, a unique path for each camera that ends with a slash and has write permissions can be entered.

parameter.name: hlsOutOptions
parameter.label: HLS Out Options
parameter.description: This gives you direct access to specify your own FFmpeg options to be used.

parameter.name: gifOutOptions
parameter.label: GIF Out Options
parameter.description: This gives you direct access to specify your own FFmpeg options to be used for animated GIF files.

parameter.name: mp4OutOptions
parameter.label: MP4 Out Options
parameter.description: This gives you direct access to specify your own FFmpeg options to be used for recording MP4 files.

parameter.name: mjpegOptions
parameter.label: MJPEG Options
parameter.description: This gives you direct access to specify your own FFmpeg options to be used for MJPEG streams.

parameter.name: snapshotOptions
parameter.label: Snapshot Options
parameter.description: Specify your own FFmpeg options to be used when creating snapshots from RTSP.

parameter.name: alarmInputUrl
parameter.label: Alarm Input URL
parameter.description: Leave blank to use the ffmpegInput as the source for detecting motion with FFmpeg, or enter any HTTP or RTSP URL. TIP: Using a low res source can save CPU usage.

parameter.name: motionOptions
parameter.label: Motion Options
parameter.description: This gives you direct access to specify your own FFmpeg options to be used for detecting motion.

parameter.name: gifPreroll
parameter.label: GIF Preroll
parameter.description: Store this many snapshots from BEFORE you trigger a GIF creation.

parameter.name: ipWhitelist
parameter.label: IP Whitelist
parameter.description: Enter any IP's inside (brackets) that you wish to allow to access the video stream. 'DISABLE' will allow all devices on your network unrestricted access.

parameter.name: updateImageWhen
parameter.label: Update Image Channel When:
parameter.description: The Image channel can be set to update in a number of ways. Recommend you set this to never updates as per the readme.

options.option: Start of Motion and Audio Alarms (23)

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.label: IP Address
parameter.description: Use this format 192.168.1.2 and do not include the port number.

parameter.name: port
parameter.label: Port for HTTP
parameter.description: This port will be used for HTTP calls for fetching the snapshot and alarm states.

parameter.name: nvrChannel
parameter.label: NVR Input Channel
parameter.description: Set this to 1 if it is a stand alone camera, or to the input channel number if you use a compatible NVR.

parameter.name: snapshotUrl
parameter.label: Snapshot URL
parameter.description: Leave blank to use the autodetected URL for snapshots, or enter a HTTP URL to where a snapshot can be seen if entered into any browser.

parameter.name: onvifPort
parameter.label: ONVIF Port
parameter.description: The port your camera uses for ONVIF connections. This is needed for PTZ movement, alarm events and auto discovery of RTSP and snapshot URLs.

parameter.name: username
parameter.label: Username
parameter.description: Enter the User name used to connect to your camera. Leave blank if your camera does not use login details.

parameter.name: password
parameter.label: Password
parameter.description: Enter the password for your camera. Leave blank if your camera does not use one.

parameter.name: ptzContinuous
parameter.label: Use Continuous PTZ
parameter.description: Select if you want Relative (false) or Continuous (true) movements.

parameter.name: onvifMediaProfile
parameter.label: ONVIF Media Profile
parameter.description: Cameras can supply more than one stream at different resolutions and formats. 0 selects the main-stream and 1 or above are the sub-streams. Sometimes you need to turn on sub-streams in the cameras setup before they can be used.

parameter.name: pollTime
parameter.label: Poll Time
parameter.description: Most features are made on demand and not polled, but some features require a regular snapshot to work. Default is "1000" which is 1 second.

thing-type.label: Instar Camera with API
thing-type.description: Use for all current INSTAR HD Cameras, as they support an API as well as ONVIF.

parameter.label: MJPEG URL
parameter.description: Leave this blank to use the auto detected URL, or enter a full HTTP address to where a MJPEG stream can be watched if entered into any browser.

parameter.name: ffmpegInput
parameter.label: FFmpeg Input
parameter.description: Leave this blank to use the auto detected RTSP address, or enter a URL for any type of stream that FFmpeg can use as an input.

parameter.description: This gives you direct access to specify FFmpeg options before the -i.

parameter.label: Motion Options
parameter.description: This gives you direct access to specify your own FFmpeg options to be used for detecting motion.

options.option: Start of Motion and Audio Alarms (23)

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.label: IP Address
parameter.description: Use this format 192.168.1.2 and do not include the port number.

parameter.name: nvrChannel
parameter.label: NVR Input Channel
parameter.description: Set this to 0 if it is a stand alone camera, or to the input channel number of your NVR that the camera is connected to.

parameter.name: port
parameter.label: Port for HTTP
parameter.description: This port will be used for HTTP calls for fetching the snapshot and alarm states.

parameter.name: snapshotUrl
parameter.label: Snapshot URL
parameter.description: Leave blank to use the autodetected URL for snapshots, or enter a HTTP URL to where a snapshot can be seen if entered into any browser.

parameter.name: onvifPort
parameter.label: ONVIF Port
parameter.description: The port your camera uses for ONVIF connections. This is needed for PTZ movement, alarm events and auto discovery of RTSP and snapshot URLs.

parameter.name: username
parameter.label: Username
parameter.description: Enter the User name used to connect to your camera. Leave blank if your camera does not use login details.

parameter.name: password
parameter.label: Password
parameter.description: Enter the password for your camera. Leave blank if your camera does not use one.

parameter.name: useToken
parameter.label: Use API Token
parameter.description: True if you want to use a Token, or false to use the user/password in each URL sent.

parameter.name: ipWhitelist
parameter.label: IP Whitelist
parameter.description: Enter any IP's inside (brackets) that you wish to allow to access the video stream. 'DISABLE' will allow all devices on your network unrestricted access.

parameter.name: ptzContinuous
parameter.label: Use Continuous PTZ
parameter.description: Select if you want Relative (false) or Continuous (true) movements.

parameter.name: onvifMediaProfile
parameter.label: ONVIF Media Profile
parameter.description: Cameras can supply more than one stream at different resolutions and formats. 0 selects the main-stream and 1 or above are the sub-streams. Sometimes you need to turn on sub-streams in the cameras setup before they can be used.

parameter.name: pollTime
parameter.label: Poll Time
parameter.description: Most features are made on demand and not polled, but some features require a regular snapshot to work. Default is "1000" which is 1 second.

channel-type.label: Image
channel-type.description: Low frame rate image from your camera. Recommend this is NOT used unless you have large pollTime.

channel-type.label: Poll Image
channel-type.description: This can be used to trigger snapshot updates when an external PIR, button or other form of sensor turns this channel ON.

channel-type.label: GIF Recording
channel-type.description: Indicates how long the recording will occur for and when the file is created, the channel will change to 0 by itself.

channel-type.label: GIF History
channel-type.description: A history of the last GIFs created in a CSV formatted string.

channel-type.label: GIF History Length
channel-type.description: How many GIFs are stored in the history.

channel-type.label: MP4 Recording
channel-type.description: Indicates how long the recording will occur for and when the file is created, the channel will change to 0 by itself.

channel-type.label: MP4 History
channel-type.description: A history of the last mp4 recordings created in a CSV formatted string.

channel-type.label: MP4 History Length
channel-type.description: How many mp4 recordings are stored in the history.

channel-type.label: Image URL
channel-type.description: A link you can use to fetch a static image from the camera.

channel-type.label: RTSP URL
channel-type.description: A link that the camera uses for RTSP.

channel-type.label: MJPEG URL
channel-type.description: A link you can use in openHAB/HABpanel to fetch a MJPEG video feed from the camera.

channel-type.label: HLS URL
channel-type.description: A link you can use in openHAB to cast video feeds.

channel-type.label: Pan
channel-type.description: Pan the camera to a new position.

channel-type.label: Tilt
channel-type.description: Tilt the camera to a new position.

channel-type.label: Zoom
channel-type.description: Zoom the camera to a new value.

channel-type.label: Last Motion Type
channel-type.description: A string that contains the type of motion alarm that was last triggered.

channel-type.label: Last Event Data
channel-type.description: A string that contains detailed data on the last alarm that was triggered.

channel-type.label: Motion Alarm
channel-type.description: Motion has been detected.

channel-type.label: Field Alarm
channel-type.description: Intrusion has detected movement. AKA Field Detection Alarm.

channel-type.label: Enable Field Alarm
channel-type.description: By using this feature you can stop the camera from sending e-mails when you are actually home.

channel-type.label: Enable PIR Alarm
channel-type.description: Enable/Disable the PIR Alarm.

channel-type.label: Cell Motion Alarm
channel-type.description: Cell based motion has been detected.

channel-type.label: PIR Alarm
channel-type.description: PIR motion has been detected.

channel-type.label: Tamper Alarm
channel-type.description: Camera may be stolen or damaged.

channel-type.label: Too Dark Alarm
channel-type.description: Image is too dark.

channel-type.label: Scene Change Alarm
channel-type.description: Camera may have been moved.

channel-type.label: Too Bright Alarm
channel-type.description: Image is too bright.

channel-type.label: Too Blurry Alarm
channel-type.description: Image is out of focus.

channel-type.label: Storage Alarm
channel-type.description: An issue with the cameras storage has been reported.

channel-type.label: FFmpeg Motion Alarm
channel-type.description: FFmpeg has detected motion.

channel-type.label: Line Crossing Alarm
channel-type.description: Motion has been detected.

channel-type.label: Face Detected Alarm
channel-type.description: A face has been detected.

channel-type.label: Item Left Alarm
channel-type.description: An item has been left.

channel-type.label: Human Alarm
channel-type.description: A person has triggered the Human Detection.

channel-type.label: Car Alarm
channel-type.description: A car has triggered the Vehicle Detection.

channel-type.label: Animal Alarm
channel-type.description: An animal has triggered the object detection.

channel-type.label: Parking Alarm
channel-type.description: A car has triggered the Parking Detection.

channel-type.label: Item Taken Alarm
channel-type.description: An item may have been stolen.

channel-type.label: Audio Alarm
channel-type.description: Audio has triggered an Alarm.

channel-type.label: Enable Alarm Input 1
channel-type.description: Turn the External Alarm Input feature on and off.

channel-type.label: Alarm In 1 TRIGGER high ON/low OFF
channel-type.description: Change the External Alarm Input to trigger on high or low states.

channel-type.label: Alarm Input 1
channel-type.description: Some cameras have alarm input wires which can be used to connect to door bells or external PIR sensors.

channel-type.label: Alarm Input 2
channel-type.description: Some cameras have alarm input wires which can be used to connect to door bells or external PIR sensors.

channel-type.label: Enable Motion Alarm
channel-type.description: By using this feature you can stop the camera from sending e-mails when you are actually home.

channel-type.label: External Motion
channel-type.description: Use any external sensor like a ZWave PIR sensor to flag that the camera has motion in its field of view.

channel-type.label: Control FFmpeg Motion Alarm
channel-type.description: Enable/Disable the motion alarm and control the sensitivity.

channel-type.label: Enable Line Crossing Alarm
channel-type.description: By using this feature you can stop the camera from sending e-mails when you are actually home.

channel-type.label: Enable Audio Alarm
channel-type.description: By using this feature you can stop the camera from sending e-mails when you are having a party.

channel-type.label: Audio Alarm Threshold
channel-type.description: By moving this control you should be able to change how sensitive the audio alarm is to soft or loud noises.

channel-type.label: Alarm Output 1 ON/OFF
channel-type.description: You can use the cameras output to trigger a device like a burglar alarm.

channel-type.label: Alarm Output 2 ON/OFF
channel-type.description: You can use the cameras output 2 to trigger a device like a burglar alarm.

channel-type.label: Start HLS Stream
channel-type.description: Lower the delay to start casting the camera by creating the files non stop in case they are needed.

channel-type.label: LED Controls
channel-type.description: Turn the LED ON and OFF and if supported also 0-100% dimming.

channel-type.label: White LED
channel-type.description: Turn the visible white LED ON and OFF and if supported 0-100% dimming.

channel-type.label: Enable Privacy Mode
channel-type.description: Turn the Privacy Mode on and off.

channel-type.label: Enable Recordings
channel-type.description: Enable/Disable the cameras internal recordings

channel-type.label: Enable FTP
channel-type.description: Turn the FTP features of the camera on and off

channel-type.label: Enable Email
channel-type.description: Turn the email features of the camera on or off

channel-type.label: Enable Push
channel-type.description: Turn the push notification features of the camera on or off

channel-type.label: Auto LED
channel-type.description: Turn the automatic mode for the LED ON and OFF.

channel-type.label: Auto White LED
channel-type.description: Turn the automatic mode for the visible white LED ON or OFF.

channel-type.label: External Light
channel-type.description: Turn the relay for external lights ON and OFF.

channel-type.label: Door Bell
channel-type.description: The button has been pushed.

channel-type.label: Text Overlay
channel-type.description: Enter some text you wish to overlay on top of the cameras snapshot and video streams.

channel-type.label: Go To Preset
channel-type.description: Move a P.T.Z camera to this ONVIF preset location.
